intro: Wulfenia blechicii var. alpina, commonly known as the alpine wulfenia, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and grayish-green, with a hairy surface to reduce water loss. Wulfenia blechicii var. alpina is often found in alpine meadows and is a hardy species that thrives in harsh mountain conditions.
